text: Ayad Futayyih Khalifa al-Rawi () (1942 - 18 May 2018) was an Iraqi general of the Iraqi Republican Guard. He later served as the head of the Jerusalem Army. He started his service in the Army as an officer in an armoured unit, later fighting in the Iran-Iraq War. He was one of Saddam Hussein's closet allies. Rawi was arrested on 4 June 2003, following the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq. Despite its claimed size, the Al Quds Army ended up playing virtually no role in the war. Rawi was born in Rawa. He died of a stroke in Baghdad on May 18, 2018, aged 76. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Iraqi politicians Category:Iraqi generals Category:Iraqi criminals
title: Ayad Futayyih Al-Rawi
